1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
properly, a habitable spot (as desirable); dry land, a coast, an island
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

2.brief: a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, a fixture, i.e. a basis; generally a place, especially as an abode
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

3.brief: the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
properly, to lick, i.e. (by implication) to blaze
(as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

4.brief: to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
lightning; by analogy, a gleam; concretely, a flashing sword
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

5.brief: a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to liquefy; figuratively, to waste (with disease), to faint (with fatigue, fear or grief)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

6.brief: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

7.brief: properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
good for nothing, by anal. vain or vanity; specifically an idol
to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, to spin round (under the influence of any violent emotion), i.e. usually rejoice, or (as cringing) fear
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

9.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

10.brief: to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense

11.brief: illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

12.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
